New Records: Suryakumar Yadav became the first Indian and only second in the world to score 1000 runs in T20Is in a calendar year.
Ravichandran Ashwin surpassed Jasprit Bumrah to become the third-highest leading wicket-taker for India in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav scored a magnificent 62-run knock.
Hardik Pandya sent back Zimbabwe skipper Craig Ervine in his first over.
India lost their fourth wicket as Rishabh Pant walked back early.
KL Rahul went back after hitting his second consecutive fifty in the T20 World Cup 2022.
Pre-Game Insights: India decided to play Rishabh Pant ahead of Dinesh Karthik.
Rohit Sharma opened on the selection at the time of the toss.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma achieved a big feat in T20I cricket, becoming the third Indian captain after MS Dhoni and Virat Kohli to lead India in 50 T20Is.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
The Indian cricket team has confirmed a semifinal spot in T20 World Cup 2022.
Others: The Indian team will need to be at their best in the remaining games.
A win for Zimbabwe will give them direct qualification for the next T20 World Cup in 2022.
